meanings.definition: To put a gun or other weapon in a holster.
meanings.sent1: He was holstering his pistol after the target practice.
meanings.sent2: She practiced holstering her knife for self-defense.
meanings.sent3: The cowboy was holstering his toy gun for the showdown at the playground.
meanings.sent4: She was holstering her words, ready to shoot them out in an argument.
meanings.sent5: The detective was holstering his suspicions, waiting for the right moment to confront the suspect.

meanings.definition: The act of placing something in a holster.
meanings.sent1: The quick holstering of the gun saved the officer's life.
meanings.sent2: She admired the craftsmanship of the leather holstering her father's revolver.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy holstering of the phone led to it slipping out and falling on the ground.
meanings.sent4: The holstering of the tools in the belt made the handyman feel prepared for any task.
meanings.sent5: The elegant holstering of the lipstick in her purse added a touch of sophistication to her style.
